website_summaries.verdict: It's compact enough to fit into almost any tool bag, but it's strong enough to get the job done.
pros: Boasts extra-wide handles that ease up some of the stress on your hands as you cut through particularly stubborn material
Meets the industry standard in strength of cutting heads, which are made of CrMo hand-forged steel
The folding feature makes it a convenient tool to carry
cons: It's a heavy set of bolt cutters, and some users had frustrating experiences with thicker rods

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage, it is so poorly put together it doesn't stay stable when you open it, it won't lock so it can't be used. Edit: Does work as a great tool to throw through your wall when your boyfriend breaks up with you over the phone while you've been physically separated during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bolt cutters to cut barbed wire and wire cattle panels. They lasted about a dozen cuts before the jaws loosened up and would not cut. I tried tightening the bolts that hold the cutters in place but the bolts only had 2 threads holding the nut on and instantly stripped the threads leaving the cutter useless. Look at other cutters and stay away from this one. Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Tropical Houser

customer_reviews.title: QC is questionable but product is good.
customer_reviews.text: I had to grind part of the metal down to allow the red lock to latch, but once I did thag they worked great. Cut through my masterlock easily. See pictures.
customer_reviews.author: J. Luna

customer_reviews.title: 00 and you'll be more than pleased with it's performance
customer_reviews.text: No need to spend a $100.00 or more on one of these, when you can buy this one for $35.00 and you'll be more than pleased with it's performance. It cut's through everything like butter, from a padlock to the heaviest gauge wire . You'll be a happy camper if you make a good choice and get this one. There are many other brands out there that are in this price range, and are totally worthless because the metal is too soft and the cutting teeth get damaged fast. You won't be disappointed with a Olympia Tools Bolt Cutter. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: vernon a. norris

customer_reviews.title: Descent cutters but blades dent when cutting with them.
customer_reviews.text: They cut a padlock but dented the cutters blades pretty significantly.
customer_reviews.author: JBL

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it cut a master lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the sole purpose of cutting a medium-sized master lock that my 18" bolt cutter couldn't dent. It did the job, with ease. And I'm no muscle bound hunk. I'll probably never use it again, so should give it four stars because I've not tested durability. But my daughter has her electric scooter back and is happy, and that earns it its final star. Yes, I'm that easily pleased. The folding cutters are cute too.
customer_reviews.author: m b

customer_reviews.title: good heavy-duty cutter
customer_reviews.text: This bolt cutter is terrific. I needed to cut a broken cable lock from a bike. The cable was almost an inch in diameter including the cover. I was able to cut through in 2 snips. The tool is very heavy and a useful addition to my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: i love these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: the weight distribution on these is great! and they take up less space when all folded down. They handle really well and are easy to control. I am very happy with my purchase. I had used a generic non-folding set before and I always felt they were so jaw heavy when transporting them, these arent that way at all! they handle great and are easy to use! They are more expensive than the cheap basic ones but if space is key, these are the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: inquisitive cat

customer_reviews.title: Gets better the more you use it
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it took some effort to open and close the jaws and they would not open more than 3/16 of an inch. I had to slightly loosen all of the nuts. The jaws would still not open more. However, the more I open and close the jaws, the wider the jaws are opening. I think the thick yellow paint is wearing down a little too, which is also helping to lessen the effort. Overall, I recommend these and the ability to fold the handles for storage is a big advantage.
customer_reviews.author: wildernessguy

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship resulting in poor function.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item TWICE and both received items had the exact same problem ... only one of the lever arms was able to lock into place when opened. Probably a good design but piss-poor manufacture. This item should be removed from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S.

customer_reviews.title: Combo Lock killer
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. The reason I bought it was to cut off a combination lock - worked fine in one snip. folding handles are a nice space saver.
customer_reviews.author: bwstrauss

customer_reviews.title: Terrible horrible cheap crap
customer_reviews.text: Holy wow. This is a shoddily built piece of garbage. There is like a literal 25degrees of slop on the hinges, the whole thing feels like it would fly apart if put under any strain at all. And there is no locking mechanism so when you have the handles folded they just kinda flop all over the place shedding paint and rust everywhere. Easy choice. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Uptop With The Whim Wham

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to cut through barbed wire taking a fence down. I love the tool and it's very easy to use, works great, but after using it a few times, a bolt came out and of course I lost it in the weeds. I did have to put another bolt on and it's been working ever since. But I just wish the bolts would have stayed in. So check the bolts every once in a while to be sure they are still tight.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Poor quality steel
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great product and idea. Well thoughout tool. Unfortunately I was only able to use it maybe 8 times before the cutting tip just fell apart trying to cut a zinc 5/16 carriage bolt. Very upset with the quality of the steel. I'm a cdl driver and need a good set of cutters. I liked the idea that these folded. Until they broke they were awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has been very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Get Home Bag. Though I have used them a couple of times already around the farm to trim fence nails and tame old barbed wire. Tool has smooth cutting action and folds down easily for stowage. Probably the single heaviest item in my pack, but worth the potential need. I would but again and recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Becker Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Foldable arm design is awesome and works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Love the foldable arm design. Compact and sharp. Unlikely you're going to get through a lock without pulling a muscle/ ruining the blade on these, but I was after something compact for lighter duty things like cutting barbed-wire, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Money But ...
customer_reviews.text: This little pair of cutters is a handy and a good price, but it is not sharp at all. I recommend using a router or sharpening stone to sharpen it. My pair of cutters came on time, but it took 10-20 cuts to cut through minor cable. You know, the kind that is on a cheap bicycle lock. I will sharpen mine further.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy just because it’s cool.
customer_reviews.text: I will hand it to them that these are very convenient in that they fold and fit into a small bag, but the metal quality sucks. I tried to cut a tiny bolt and it just crushed the cutting edge down. The cool/convenient factor is the only reason it gets 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Skylinerunner

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on wire shelves
customer_reviews.text: I have used many bolt cutters in the past and knew I would have to manage my expectations with this one. I specifically purchased it to cut those standard white wire closet storage shelves and it performed flawlessly for that purpose. I would hesitate to use these on anything that was more robust than 1/4" mild steel. I suppose it would be possible to cut thicker material but it would require significant force and several attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I was concerned about the folding feature impairing the cutting ...
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the folding feature impairing the cutting ability, that concern was unfounded. They handled cutting chain (my main need for these) with no problem whatsoever. The folding design on the handles is such that the hinges don't have to deal with any of the strain when cutting, so they should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Beer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the 24 inch
customer_reviews.text: Ive had the same pair of cutters 20 years of truck driving. Bought these 42 inch ones first. OVERKILL. Ill keep em as a gag gift to other truckers who "borrow" cutters. Purchased the 24 inch. More than perfect for truck driving.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree B.

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: I tried multiple chains with no luck. I had to go to Home Depot and buy a real one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt R.

customer_reviews.title: Value priced, heavy duty construction
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a set of bolt cutters for my vehicle, and these fit the bill very well, and take up less space. Jaws are well made, open wide, and fit tight. Note: there are “case hardened” lock shackles out there that will damage even the most expensive bolt cutters. Easy way past it is to cut the chain or latch, and saves the cutting head.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Grind

customer_reviews.title: Defective red latch, but works.
customer_reviews.text: Red latch to keep the handle in place after unfolding is offset so opening the cutter head is a bit akward. can be used as is or grinded down to make the latch close with said defect. cut through 1/4" masterlock easily. defiantly should have this quality control issue solved after I see the first picture is from 2015, 2 years is ridiculous. it works so hey I'm satisfied once I fixed as another had recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: 5/10 it's okay
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a short time. Then all the nuts started coming loose an one popped off and flew into the void, never to be seen again. All things considered, I guess it's about what I expected
customer_reviews.author: Seth H

customer_reviews.title: Space saving n works great!
customer_reviews.text: They work great, make sure to lock them i place otherwise if half locked will come loose! Love the folding feature. Adjustment screw lil too long as unable to screw down more to get a tip closer, good for small screws n locks.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Way stronger than sheet metal cutters
customer_reviews.text: Way stronger than sheet metal cutters. It folds, but be warned that it is still surprisingly big folded, roughly 3x the total mass of sheet metal cutters. But at least it can be stored in a drawer or something due to the folding feature. I'm sure this thing has limits, but bigger bolt cutters are gigantic.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: mean for the size
customer_reviews.text: as a 60 year old woman with shoulder problems I needed a cutter that was extra strong. I have to stay compact with my tools so a full size cutter was out of the question. This cutter is easy to use, strong and folds up for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: High strength and quality cutter
customer_reviews.text: High strength and quality cutter. I used it to cut through 3/8" thick cattle panels for my garden with a breeze. Very comfortable to handle and I like that you can fold them up for storage. The previous 14" cutter I purchased at the local box store didn't hold up very good when used for the same job.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Poor folding pivot very loose n sloppy
customer_reviews.text: Cool lookin n folding but terrible quality control none handles wiggle n very loose trying to tighten but not working pass on these till the chinease get it right
customer_reviews.author: diver guy

customer_reviews.title: Missing nuts
customer_reviews.text: The handles are missing 2 nuts that hold the bolts in that hold the handles onto the cutters! Please, contact me about getting these 2 nuts. Tim E. O'Neill, DVM
customer_reviews.author: drtimone

customer_reviews.title: Bolt Cutter failed during 2nd session of use.
customer_reviews.text: As can be seen from the image provided, there are five bolts acting as pivots for the cutter. Two of these bolts lost their securing nut during the second session of use. I have not been able to find the nuts which will have fallen to the ground. My advice is not to buy this bolt cutter until such time as the design fault is corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Folding makes it easier to store. GREAT idea.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Zucks

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This item was received in pieces, not fully put together. All of the bolt & nuts were loose and of different sizes. The nut & bolt head sizes were different for each item. Nothing was consistent. After it was fully put together it was still loose and hard to use. Very unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T Bickel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: These things work great and store well in my toolbox. No quality issues at all. I may get a bigger pair for larger work, I had to put some oomph into it on a standard sized combination lock.
customer_reviews.author: ZSW

customer_reviews.title: Good small bolt cutter. Be sure to lubricate before use
customer_reviews.text: Good small bolt cutter. Be sure to lubricate before use
customer_reviews.author: Santa and elf

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: These bolt cutters are great! I've only cut one lock with them so far, but they cut right through it with the greatest of ease. The folding feature for storage is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Big and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my truck driver son. He hasn't had to use them yet but they will certainly do the job.
customer_reviews.author: waterbug74

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would be put off by the folding handles, turn out this was a HUGE asset for storing in my bug out box. Tried them around the shop and cut through a 5/16” hex head bolt, NO PROBLEM. Buy these.
customer_reviews.author: lainielover

customer_reviews.title: Good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Because they fold I can keep them in my tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: Steven stamper

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Soft jaws wont cut 1/8" steel rod. Don't bother with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great tool great quality. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality. The folding handles lock up very securely and it is very nice to be able to fit them in a tool bag. I cut some rusty old barbed wire with them and they went through it with no resistance at all. No visible damage after several cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Fredicus

customer_reviews.title: Great at cutting padlocks
customer_reviews.text: If you need to cut open a padlock this will do it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Truhls

customer_reviews.title: Fair price, great value
customer_reviews.text: It cut through a heavy braided bicycle lock cable with ease on the first try. I was amazed.
customer_reviews.author: richard j innis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice design. I am concerned about the plastic lock ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design. I am concerned about the plastic lock part. Only reason I did not give it 5 stars. I have cut some screws for testing and it was easy. No bends or chips in the blade. Appears to work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtymike

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and well-executed otherwise
customer_reviews.text: One of the folding hinges is slightly loose, but still strong and functional. Great idea and well-executed otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Bri n Dan

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Tool is awesome. Keep it in my truck for emergency
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hill

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Used this to dismantle a chain link fence. Cut through it like butter. It’s neat how the handles fold up, really saves space.
customer_reviews.author: a guy

customer_reviews.title: Better than more expensive bolt cutters
customer_reviews.text: Came with a stripped out bolt and the mfg took care of it extremely quickly. I love these things!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Strafach

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: It cut through 1/8" diameter chain links with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Small But Mighty
customer_reviews.text: Small but mighty. Packs easily in a small tool box or tool bag. Very handy. Resonably priced. Small capacity, but does well within its limitations. I intend to purchase the larger cutters at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: TLM80209

customer_reviews.title: Can’t cut threw wire cable tray my Linemans can this cannot
customer_reviews.text: If you use at home on flowers I’m sure it would work
customer_reviews.author: Dontknowanything

customer_reviews.title: 2 uses before breaking
customer_reviews.text: I had this about a month. I was able to use it twice. Before they broke. Return window closed 4 days ago. So can’t return it and get a set that won’t break after 2 uses. That were within spec of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Put 3-1 oil on the joints and it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I had to slightly file one side sown where the clip goes when you open. Put 3-1 oil on the joints and it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Atomdata

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I tried using it. Blades flexed immediately. Wedging the padlock in between the blades. Then the threads on the bolts that hold the blades together sheared off.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Voccola

customer_reviews.title: simple, easy, foldable
customer_reviews.text: Made the necessary cuts with ease. Folds up for ease in storage. Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Jahi Simbai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for personal storage
customer_reviews.text: Great bolt cutters and the ability to fold makes them perfect for easy storage in my Go-Bag. When the handles are fully extended, they are strong and sturdy as if they didn't fold at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutter every household must have one even contactor to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Cutter every household must have one even contactor to I like it,Next time I will buy long one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Folding ability is a major plus. The Bolt Cutters ...
customer_reviews.text: Folding ability is a major plus. The Bolt Cutters are well made and work as intended. My only reservation is that one of the folding handles is loose on its hinge, allowing it to swing freely, whereas the other is far stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: Maestroso

customer_reviews.title: Not for really heavy cutting but works for the normal house guy like me.
customer_reviews.text: Always needed one, now I have one. Not for really heavy cutting but works for the normal house guy like me.
customer_reviews.author: Ultracon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and with a little leverage cuts even big locks
customer_reviews.text: The best and portable, someone is always loosing the lock keys
customer_reviews.author: Rock N Roll

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking big enough to get the job done????,yet small enough to take with you on the go
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Really liked the compact design
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the compact design! Felt sturdy, however the second lock we cut they broke. Fortunately, there was a good no hassle return policy. Hoping we just had a faulty set.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well!
customer_reviews.text: Easily cut though a 9/32 inch "hardened" steel padlock after I lost the keys to it, which is why I needed it. So now I have a useful tool, and the experience to know how weak the padlock I had was. Time to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these to cut livestock panels, they are gonna last a long time and cut with little effort. The folding design makes them easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Functional + Portable
customer_reviews.text: They work great, and I love they way they fold up for convenience and portability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's a good thing
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful!! I got this for a post-apocalypse hooligan kit and it folds up so small I wish I had gotten the 24in
customer_reviews.author: Drew A.

customer_reviews.title: Power Grip great design....
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to fold it down to a more compact size (fits great in my toolbox). At first I was a little septal about the fact that it did fold. That it might make the tool less stable. I'm Glad I took a chance. The design of this tool is great. Vary stable and well made. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light
customer_reviews.text: These are great compact bolt cutters. Very good for quick light duty work.
customer_reviews.author: niartdfiqabvt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. And its easy to store. Perfect size for almost any job.
customer_reviews.author: ABAllen2010

customer_reviews.title: Despite the accurate description as to weight and length, ...
customer_reviews.text: Despite the accurate description as to weight and length, these were bigger and heavier than I imagined. I bought the larger size to get the wider opening of the cutting blades. Any opening smaller than on these would not give you much of a range of cutting capabilities. These are basically the same as a less expensive pair I have had for decades, but with a slightly narrower cutter and the folding feature. I have gained a little convenience in portability, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: CB3

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: compact enough to be in my car all the time.
customer_reviews.author: ToxinDoc

customer_reviews.title: A good quality bolt cutter at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bolt cutter. It's made in China in case you were wondering, but appears to be very well made. It easily cuts small bolts with ease. The handles fold smoothly and lock each time with no issues. I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to friends who were in the market for a bolt cutter at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Olson

customer_reviews.title: A bit more than what I needed it for...
customer_reviews.text: But I still wanted it. I had to cut some links off my punching bag and no problems and is compact as mentioned. I was concerned about the durability of it since it has more moving parts but that quickly faded. Very sturdy. If I had one issue it would be the video. It's seems to be slightly advertising to criminals on the compactness of it. But you won't be disatisfied. And much cheaper than brands you'll find at the two big stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great cutters and fold up to fit in my tool box
customer_reviews.author: William Long

customer_reviews.title: Not commercial grade but excellent for non commercial uses
customer_reviews.text: OK for general use. Not commercial grade but excellent for non commercial uses.
customer_reviews.author: mar

customer_reviews.title: large handles and comfortable grips. The latch machanisn which keeps them locked ...
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use these but am reviewing to speak to BUILD QUALITY which seems surprisingly high. Heavy, large handles and comfortable grips. The latch machanisn which keeps them locked open/straight for use appears robust too. These have noticeably more heft than my other 24" bolt cutters, which I think is good but may be a hinderance if using overhead.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: These cutters are extremely heavy and would not cut a ...
customer_reviews.text: These cutters are extremely heavy and would not cut a 5/16 non hardened chain. No matter how much force were applied to them and one point i thought the handles would bend they would not cut, the have no decent leverage. look elsewhere . Update to my first review, after sitting in the shop for about 6-8 months i tried them again on some 5/16 reinforcing rod the would not cut that soft metal a second person tried and failed so i threw them in the dumpster
customer_reviews.author: dalailama23

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Snapped when I tried to use it to cut a combination deadbolt
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the red locking clips
customer_reviews.text: I've just gotten mine in the mail, and it has the same locking clips problem mentioned in another review. The red clip on one side is out of tolerance, and won't engage to lock that side. I'm going to have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: T. Van Belle

customer_reviews.title: Autobot or Decepticon Transformer Bolt Cutter? Only Time Will Tell.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sweet bolt cutter. I like that it folds up to a more compact size. Hopefully, there won't be any issues with it down the line. Typically, the more moving parts an item has, the more prone to failure and/or issues can develop. I'll cross my fingers and hope it holds up over time. Otherwise, I'll update this review with any new information.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Kim

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Like budda cuts 10 guage steel wire like butter. No effort!! Barbed wire like it was copper ! Cutting down some fencing went real quick.would recommend these all day.
customer_reviews.author: monty waggoner

customer_reviews.title: Not just to trim your nails. But you can actually trim screws too.
customer_reviews.text: Bought small version. Wish I had larger. Oh well. Not going to hurt to buy more. So. 5 star. Have cut many items with these little portable lock cutters. I mean...Bolt cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Forgotten lock combo solver
customer_reviews.text: Took it right out of the package and immediately cut off two standard school/gym locker combo locks (forgotten combos) off of an old gym bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bennet L Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Neat space saver!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent idea and great product! Love how they save so much space.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a real working tool and it is heavy duty. It folds to approximately 1/2 it's extended size. I am a backwood hunter and have found myself in need of being able to free myself from captivity. My test was to cut a 3/8 inch bolt and the hasp of a master lock. The tool cut through them with minimal effort. If all you are cutting is fence material this would be over kill but would do that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carpenter For Christ

customer_reviews.title: Handy too to have around
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with these. They do what I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting ability but limited in the size of what ...
customer_reviews.text: Great cutting ability but limited in the size of what you can cut.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: The tool is okay seems underpowered and struggles to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: The tool is okay seems underpowered and struggles to cut 1/4 item bolts. Another concern is that is not mention on the listing. This product uses materials known to cause cancer or reproductive harm? The amazon listing should be upfront with that, I wouldn't have bought it otherwise or looked around. I understand some cheaper items might use lead paint, or vinyl but this item is charging a premium twice the price of other bolt cutters from China and shouldn't be using short cuts or questionable materials for that price range. That's just my two cents.
customer_reviews.author: B L

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not really big enough to do much. It's ok for cutting heavy wire
customer_reviews.author: Plant Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective unit, Act with caution when purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective unit packaged in a transparent clear plastic bag, a simple visual inspection during packaging could have prevented my unsatisfactory experience. Item had a bent pivot pin for the handle latch, still allowed the item to pivot into position but both the latch and notch were misaligned by over a 1/8 inch due to pin and over-spray of the finishing paint. Absolutely useless and potentially dangerous if someone were to attempt to use this product in this condition. Act with caution when purchasing...cant wait to see how much shipping back will cost.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Does not make a tight cut in small spaces.  Heavy and very stiff to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to use if you aren't very strong. Lubricating it might help, but if you are cutting a lot of things it is very tiring (not because of what you are cutting but because of the product). I probably ordered too large of a size for my need, it is very heavy. Most important to me is that you can't get a tight cut in a small space. I use this to cut wire shelving for a specific use and the design keeps me from getting close and making a nice cut. That said, I'm sure this would work find for other applications.
customer_reviews.author: LinDe

product_meta.title: Power Grip Bolt Cutter, 39-118, 18 Inches
product_meta.description: Size:18-InchOlympia Tools 39-118 Power Grip Bolt Cutter, 18-Inch, Compact Bolt Cutter, Easy Storage, CR-MO Hardened-Steel Cutting Blade, Ergonomic Comfort Grips, Heavy-Duty Cutting Strength
feature_bullets: BOLT CUTTER: The heat-treated & drop-forged alloy steel jaws are ideal for cutting hard & soft metals with ease. The 18-inch long handles & compound hinges help maximize leverage & cutting force.

HIGH QUALITY: Patented folding handles allow bolt cutters to easily fit in a bag. Ergonomic comfort grips and heavy-duty cutting strength. Extra-wide handles significantly reduce pressure on the hands.
MADE TO LAST: Our durable and long-lasting tools help you with home, garage & industrial projects. With professional-grade quality, easily repair & fix issues with our tool cabinet essentials.

THE RIGHT TOOL FOR THE JOB: We engineer a range of bolt cutters, clamps, chisels, folding carts, hammers, pliers, saws, screwdrivers, tape measures, utility knives, vises, bolt cutters, saws & wrenches.
SUPERIOR INSTRUMENTS: Olympia Tools provides quality & innovative hand & specialty tools, tool accessories & outdoor equipment for construction, woodworking, mechanical maintenance & home repair.
